title: U.S. Job Growth Likely Picked Up in September
sub_head: Employers still report a shortage of job applicants despite strong demand for workers and rising wages
body:
U.S. job growth likely rebounded last month as schools reopened and leisure and hospitality businesses stepped up hiring. But a persistent shortage of workers is restraining the labor marketâ€™s recovery, economists say.
Economists estimate that employers created 500,000 jobs in September, more than double the number added in August, according to a Wall Street Journal survey. The jobless rate is believed to have declined to 5.1% from 5.2% a month earlier.
